required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Extended-release Injectable Buprenorphine for Individuals at High Risk of Overdose
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study to Assess the Feasibility, Efficacy and Safety of Extended-release Injectable Buprenorphine for the Treatment of Opioid Use Disorder Among Individuals at High Risk of Overdose

brief_summary.textblock: Pilot study evaluating the feasibility and clinical utility of extended-release injectable buprenorphine (XR-BUP) for the treatment of opioid use disorder (OUD) among individuals at high-risk for overdose (OD).

detailed_description.textblock: Participants will receive a total of 6 subcutaneous monthly injections of extended-release buprenorphine, as well as medical management as per the local standard of care.

primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome for this study will be retention in treatment, defined as having received the six scheduled XR-BUP injections and completed the EOT/Early Termination visit.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of treatment-engaged visits per participant
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of treatment-engaged visits per participant will be calculated as the number of received XR-BUP injections divided by the number of scheduled injections (i.e., six).

secondary_outcome.description: Suppression of illicit opioid use will be measured as the percentage of opioid-free weeks during the active treatment period (Visit 2 to Visit 8), using a combination of Urine Drug Test (UDT) results and self-reported illicit opioid use.

Descriptive statistics will be used for all safety analysis variables. No formal inferential tests will be performed on safety data. The incidence of all AEs will be summarized by body system, severity, seriousness, and relationship to the study drug using MedDRA. SAEs will be tabulated by patient. Descriptive statistics will be reported for injection site grading. Descriptive summaries will be provided for vital signs based on the change from baseline.

arm_group.description: This consists of 2 once-monthly 300 mg followed by 4 once-monthly 100 mg subcutaneous injections.

intervention.description: Once-monthly subcutaneous injectable buprenorphine product; Extended-Release Injectable Buprenorphine 100 mg/0.5 mL prefilled syringe; Extended-Release Injectable Buprenorphine 300 mg/1.5 mL prefilled syringe.

overall_official.affiliation: Assistant Professor, Department of Medicine, University of British Columbia

facility.name: Rapid Access Addiction Clinic (RAAC), St. Paul's Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant Professor, Department of Medicine, UBC; Research Scientist, BCCSU
